      • cleanIpAddress

        private java.lang.String cleanIpAddress​(java.lang.String ipAddress)
        Cleans the ip address eg. localhost/127.0.0.1 will be just 127.0.0.1
        Parameters:
        ipAddress - IpAddress to be cleaned
        Returns:
        Cleaned ip address

        public void write()
           throws java.lang.Exception
        Writes to hosts file
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Throws exception if host already exits or file is not writable

      • write

        private void write​(java.lang.String output,
                   boolean append)
            throws java.lang.Exception
        Private method that writes to system hosts file
        Parameters:
        output - Actual string that will be dumped to the system Hosts file
        append - Deferments if the first parameter will be appended to the file or file will be completely rewritten
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - This exception is thrown when user doesn't have permission to write to file

      • get

        public static Host get​(java.lang.String hostName)
                throws HostNotFoundException
        Gets single host from the Hosts file
        Parameters:
        hostName - domain
        Returns:
        new instance of Hosts class
        Throws:
        HostNotFoundException - if the hosts isn't found

      • readFile

        private static java.util.List<java.lang.String> readFile()
                                                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Reads all Lines of the HOSTS file in List
        Returns:
        List of strings
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - This exception is thrown when file is not readable or user doesn't have permission to read it

      • read

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.net.InetAddress> read()
        Reading the hosts file into Map of String (Domain name) as key and InetAddress as Ip address
        Returns:
        Map

      • rewrite

        private void rewrite()
              throws java.lang.Exception
        Rewriting Hosts file after update or delete
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - This exception is thrown when user doesn't have access to read or write to the file

        public void update​(Host newHost)
            throws java.lang.Exception
        Updates existing host
        Parameters:
        newHost - new Host to override the existing one

            throws java.lang.Exception
